info.title: Traccar
info.description: Traccar GPS tracking server API documentation. To use the API you need to have a server instance. For testing purposes you can use one of free [demo servers](https://www.traccar.org/demo-server/). For production use you can install your own server or get a [subscription service](https://www.traccar.org/product/tracking-server/).

tags.name: Permissions
tags.description: User permissions and other object linking

tags.name: Commands
tags.description: Sending commands to devices and stored command management

get.summary: Fetch a list of Saved Commands
get.description: Without params, it returns a list of Drivers the user has access to

parameters.name: all
parameters.description: Can only be used by admins or managers to fetch all entities

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Standard users can use this only with their own _userId_

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Standard users can use this only with _deviceId_s, they have access to

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: Standard users can use this only with _groupId_s, they have access to

get.summary: Fetch a list of Saved Commands supported by Device at the moment
get.description: Return a list of saved commands linked to Device and its groups, filtered by current Device protocol support

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Standard users can use this only with _deviceId_s, they have access to

400.description: Could happen when the user doesn't have permission for the device

post.description: Dispatch a new command or Saved Command if _body.id_ set

400.description: Could happen when the user doesn't have permission or an incorrect command _type_ for the device

get.summary: Fetch a list of available Commands for the Device or all possible Commands if Device ommited

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Internal device identifier. Only works if device has already reported some locations

parameters.name: protocol
parameters.description: Protocol name. Can be used instead of device id

parameters.name: textChannel
parameters.description: When `true` return SMS commands. If not specified or `false` return data commands

400.description: Could happen when trying to fetch from a device the user does not have permission

get.description: Without any params, returns a list of the user's devices

parameters.name: all
parameters.description: Can only be used by admins or managers to fetch all entities

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Standard users can use this only with their own _userId_

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: To fetch one or more devices. Multiple params can be passed like `id=31&id=42`

parameters.name: uniqueId
parameters.description: To fetch one or more devices. Multiple params can be passed like `uniqueId=333331&uniqieId=44442`

put.summary: Update total distance and hours of the Device

get.description: Without any params, returns a list of the Groups the user belongs to

parameters.name: all
parameters.description: Can only be used by admins or managers to fetch all entities

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Standard users can use this only with their own _userId_

post.summary: Link an Object to another Object

delete.summary: Unlink an Object from another Object

get.description: We strongly recommend using [Traccar WebSocket API](https://www.traccar.org/traccar-api/) instead of periodically polling positions endpoint. Without any params, it returns a list of last known positions for all the user's Devices. _from_ and _to_ fields are not required with _id_.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: _deviceId_ is optional, but requires the _from_ and _to_ parameters when used

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: To fetch one or more positions. Multiple params can be passed like `id=31&id=42`

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Can only be used by admin or manager users

get.description: Without params, it returns a list of Notifications the user has access to

parameters.name: all
parameters.description: Can only be used by admins or managers to fetch all entities

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Standard users can use this only with their own _userId_

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Standard users can use this only with _deviceId_s, they have access to

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: Standard users can use this only with _groupId_s, they have access to

get.summary: Fetch a list of available Notification types

post.summary: Send test notification to current user via Email and SMS

400.description: Could happen if sending has failed

get.summary: Fetch a list of Positions within the time period for the Devices or Groups
get.description: At least one _deviceId_ or one _groupId_ must be passed

get.summary: Fetch a list of Events within the time period for the Devices or Groups
get.description: At least one _deviceId_ or one _groupId_ must be passed

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: % can be used to return events of all types

get.description: At least one _deviceId_ or one _groupId_ must be passed

get.summary: Fetch a list of ReportStops within the time period for the Devices or Groups
get.description: At least one _deviceId_ or one _groupId_ must be passed

get.description: Without params, it returns a list of Maintenance the user has access to

parameters.name: all
parameters.description: Can only be used by admins or managers to fetch all entities

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Standard users can use this only with their own _userId_

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Standard users can use this only with _deviceId_s, they have access to

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: Standard users can use this only with _groupId_s, they have access to

userId.description: User Id, can be only first parameter

deviceId.description: Device Id, can be first parameter or second only in combination with userId

groupId.description: Group Id, can be first parameter or second only in combination with userId

geofenceId.description: Geofence Id, can be second parameter only

calendarId.description: Calendar Id, can be second parameter only and only in combination with userId

attributeId.description: Computed Attribute Id, can be second parameter only

driverId.description: Driver Id, can be second parameter only

managedUserId.description: User Id, can be second parameter only and only in combination with userId

Permission.description: This is a permission map that contain two object indexes. It is used to link/unlink objects. Order is important. Example: { deviceId:8, geofenceId: 16 }

all.name: all
all.description: Can only be used by admins or managers to fetch all entities

userId.name: userId
userId.description: Standard users can use this only with their own _userId_

deviceId.name: deviceId
deviceId.description: Standard users can use this only with _deviceId_s, they have access to

groupId.name: groupId
groupId.description: Standard users can use this only with _groupId_s, they have access to
